Good luck. The shodo will help. So will studying worksheets. I have to 
fin=
d the picture, I cut it out and put it somewhere.

Gordon

On 2003.11.9, at=
 04:15  PM, Jim Gilbert wrote:

> Hi Gordon,
> I'd like to see the pictures=
 of Choshu-ya's koshirae if you can do it.=A0
>
> I'm in the middle of a sh=
odo course at Japan Society in NYC and plan 
> to keep at it.=A0 Token and =
kodogu are hard enough, but the koshirae 
> worksheet descriptions are goin=
g to be a monster challenge.=A0 Edo 
> period machibori kodogu kantei is al=
so going to take a lot of work.=A0 I 
> don't know about four years but it =
sure is motivating.
>
> Jim
>
>
>
> =A0 Hi Jim,
>
> =A0 You're welcome. May=
be soon we can have katakana on our fittings
> =A0 kanteisho!! Since this i=
nformation didn't go out on this list, let me
> =A0 add that kenkyu-in is t=
he first step to becoming a member of the 
> shinsa
> =A0 team. All of the =
members of the present team went through the ranks.
> =A0 The next step is =
shinsa-in hosa, which means an assistant to the 
> shinsa
> =A0 team. Assis=
tants should fill out the working papers -- in Japanese. I
> =A0 could some=
what manage this, but in the end, I was given a break. The
> =A0 third stag=
e is full shinsa team member. This all typically takes 
> about
> =A0 four =
years or so from kenkyu-in to full shinsa team member.
>
> =A0 I will also =
try and scan a photo of Choshu-ya's koshirae. I don't 
> think
> =A0 it sol=
d.
